t: Hear*pn now what the Lord*s is saying, “Arise,*ln plead your case before the mountains, And*ln let the hills hear your voice.
Listen,*ln you mountains, to the indictment of the Lord,*s And*ln you enduring foundations of the earth, Because*ln the Lord*s has a case against His people; Even*ln with Israel He will dispute.
My*ln people, what have I done to you, And*ln how have I wearied you? Answer Me.
Indeed,*ln I brought you up from the land of Egypt And*ln ransomed you from the house of slavery, And*ln I sent before you Moses, Aaron and Miriam.

My*ln people, remember now What*ln Balak king of Moab counseled And*ln what Balaam son of Beor answered him, And*iln from Shittim to Gilgal, So*ln that you might know the righteous acts of the Lord.”*s
With*pn what shall I come to the Lord*s And*iln bow myself before the God on high? Shall*ln I come to Him with burnt offerings, With*ln yearling calves?
Does*ln the Lord*s take delight in thousands of rams, In*ln ten thousand rivers of oil? Shall*ln I present my firstborn for*i my rebellious acts, The*ln fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?
He*ln has told you, O man, what is good; And*ln what does the Lord*s require of you But*ln to do justice, to love kindness, And*ln to walk humbly with your God?
The*ln voice of the Lord*s will call to the city— And*ln it is sound wisdom to fear Your name: “Hear,*ln O tribe. Who has appointed its time?
Is*ln there yet a man in the wicked house, Along*iln with*i treasures of wickedness And*ln a short measure that*i is*i cursed?
Can*ln I justify wicked scales And*ln a bag of deceptive weights?
For*ln the rich men of the*i city are full of violence, Her*ln residents speak lies, And*ln their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
So*ln also I will make you*i sick, striking you down, Desolating*ln you*i because of your sins.

You*ln will eat, but you will not be satisfied, And*ln your vileness will be in your midst. You*ln will try*i to*i remove for*i safekeeping,*i But*ln you will not preserve anything,*i And*ln what you do preserve I will give to the sword.
You*ln will sow but you will not reap. You*ln will tread the olive but will not anoint yourself with oil; And*ln the grapes, but you will not drink wine.

The*ln statutes of Omri And*ln all the works of the house of Ahab are observed; And*ln in their devices you walk. Therefore*ln I will give you up for destruction And*ln your inhabitants for derision, And*ln you will bear the reproach of My people.”
